item.title: Female president?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Radeon’s article is nothing but a mixture of Non sequitur and Bare assertion logical fallacy.

However nobody seems to worry about logical fallacies these days, people are just content to have misinformation and fuzzy logic enter their heads.

About this censorious instinct: we basically know already what we need to know, and we’ve known it for a long time, it comes from an old story about a great Englishman – Dr Samuel Johnson, the great lexicographer, complier of the first great dictionary of the English language. When it was complete Dr Johnson was waited upon by various delegations of people to congratulate him. Of the nobility, of equality, of the Common, of the Lords and also by a delegation of respectable ladies of London who attended on him in his Fleet Street lodgings and congratulated him.

“Dr Johnson”, they said, “We are delighted to find that you’ve not included any indecent or obscene words in your dictionary.”

“Ladies”, said Dr Johnson, “I congratulate you on being able to look them up.”

If any of you can understand that, you get the point about the censorship instinct. For those who can’t I’ll summarise.
You probably only want to censor something because you yourself secretly want to do it.

Read full topic

No, multiply wrong doesn’t make right.

the ‘right’ thing isn’t always whats normal[/quote]

item.title: Female president?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

If you have church and state separated, then why is 99% of US politicians Christian? Sure, there is no direct influence from the church, but there is a lot christian conservative idiocy to be found in the US laws.

To bend the topic a bit: The ex-biggest party in the Netherlands, a christian party, even dared to say that our country would be worse without a christian PM. Luckily they got decimated in the last elections. The leader of this party also whined about the lack of ‘Dutch East Indies Company-mentality’. Ah… the good old slave trading times. I do miss them.

The odds of a corrupt person being christian is higher then him being non-christian. A lot of preachers turn out to be frauds.

item.title: Female president?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:78, topic:345519”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=441901.msg3268580#msg3268580 date=1279050879]
Yet you have politicians shouting about “god” in their speeches
[/quote]
You’re just like those dicks who come to our country and want the word god taken out of the pledge of allegiance.[/quote]

You mean… those foul atheist scum want to remove ‘under god’ which was only added by Christians in the 1950s?

Frell:

You’re just like those dicks who come to our country and want the word phrase ‘in god we trust’ taken out of the pledge of allegiance. put on our money.

Fixed.

Frell:

Being religious is nothing out of the ordinary, not being religious is out of the ordinary.

Frell:

You atheists always act like the world is full of atheists and the ones that are not normal are religious.

Kind of being a hypocrite there… but majority rules I guess?

Really though can we drop this whole U ARE AN ATHEIST U MUST SUBSCRIBE TO THIS OR THAT, or U ARE A CHRISTIAN YOU MUST BELIEVE THIS OR THAT THEN pls? guys?

Radeon:

I would rather have a god-fearing person rule a country than an atheist. Even if you think his belief is mythical, at least he has a reason not to be corrupt. I’m not saying theists can’t be corrupt, but at least they have one more reason than atheists to not be corrupt.

I find the opposite to be true. We can come back and talk about theists not being corrupt when scientists start waging wars over their interpretations of the origin of species.

Frell:

Not specifically on Christianity but on god and gods rule. i.e no killing, stealing, rape etc Refer to the above paragraph to why the country could be based off of god.

REALLY Frell? If a cornerstone of your argument is that rape/theft/whatever isn’t allowed because it also happens to be a commandment, therefore supporting whatever you were saying(kinda skimmed a lot of it !) then you really need a new fucking argument. Wow.

[quote=“Frell, post:113, topic:345519”]No, its because im the only one on the forums that has the time to argue with people like you. Not only that, but you guys cant even argue (should say debate) in a sensible, humane way.

[snip]

I don’t know alot on that subject so i may be wrong. And i probably am, but sure enough you all attack it. Welcome to moparisthebest.com[/quote]

ITT: say stupid uneducated shit expecting not to be mocked. Welcome to moparisthebest.com

item.title: Female president?
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

The brain doing what it has evolved to do is not a valid argument for banning everything pleasurable in life.
Married men who are involved in pornography feel less satisfied with their conjugal relations and less emotionally attached to their wives.

@Radeon

Think of every idea that has shaped society, that has drastically changed our views, and made us see ourselves in a different perspective. Whether it has been television, the internet, video games or pornography; the only thing people were afraid of is going against what they believe and value. You can’t corrupt society. It’s ever-evolving. It’s all of us, just thinking and doing. The only thing you can corrupt is the morals, values and beliefs which your friends, family, peers and idols may have influenced you to abide by.

The brain has been doing exactly what it evolved to do. Pretty much voids your entire argument.

PS: your are dum niga

Read full topic

item.title: Female president?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Since the brain believes what the eyes see, in 3/10ths of a second, real, virtual or pseudo pornography restructures the brains-minds and memories of participants or even casual viewers. That the brain’s “internal drug store” produces mood altering psychotropic drugs

Oh right, I totally missed this part. I wish HexKey was still here, he’d not only get a kick out of it but I’m sure he could tell you you’re dumb much more eloquently than I can.

EDIT But since he isn’t:

I’m reluctant to accept the label “addictive” as an alternative term for “habit forming”. Somewhere in recent years the word addictive changed from having an actual concrete meaning to meaning “I have a habit” or “I’m too much of a pussy to take control of my own life”. Regardless, since everyone else is using it to mean this (“mental” addiction - lol.) I guess I’ll concede that under this definition, sure, porn is probably addictive in certain individuals - in the same way that using the internet is, playing games is and posting on forums is (you better get off the computer now, for fear of ruining your family life).

As for “psychotropic drug stores” in the brain - they don’t exist. Pretty much by definition, “drug” doesn’t include endogenous substances. I’d ask for more explanation of what you think that line meant, but what I’d get would be some bullshit about the reward mechanisms in the human brain and a big fat misunderstanding of how neurotransmitters and the CNS in general work, and nobody needs to read those articles again, they’re the food of concerned mothers everywhere already. (OMG OUR CHILDREN ARE ADDICTED TO PLEASURE, DAMN THAT DOPAMINE IT MAKES VIDEO GAMES LIKE COCAINE!).

If you want to have an argument about the social impact of pornography, or well anything else, I’d love to do it, chatting shit on the internet is my game.

But please fuck keep the pseudo science out of it. Read a goddamn book or something before you go there, or people are just going to laugh at you. The brain doing what it has evolved to do is not a valid argument for banning everything pleasurable in life.

EDIT2: I forgot I can’t use the word designed with regards to the brain in this context due to present company misunderstanding it

Read full topic

item.title: Female president?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

yakman:

How exactly is porn guilty?

It corrupts society. Have you not considered that it fuels man’s sexual desires, causing one to expect more out of their partner? More than what is realistically possible?

Pornography is a visual representation of sexuality which distorts an individual’s concept of the nature of conjugal relations. This, in turn, alters both sexual attitudes and behavior. It is a major threat to marriage, to family, to children and to individual happiness. In undermining marriage it is one of the factors in undermining social stability. Social scientists, clinical psychologists, and biologists have begun to clarify some of the social and psychological effects, and neurologists are beginning to delineate the biological mechanisms through which pornography produces its powerful negative effects. KEY FINDINGS ON THE EFFECTS OF PORNOGRAPHY THE FAMILY AND PORNOGRAPHY • Married men who are involved in pornography feel less satisfied with their conjugal relations and less emotionally attached to their wives. Wives notice and are upset by the difference. • Pornography use is a pathway to infidelity and divorce, and is frequently a major factor in these family disasters. • Among couples affected by one spouse’s addiction, two-thirds experience a loss of interest in sexual intercourse. • Both spouses perceive pornography viewing as tantamount to infidelity. • Pornography viewing leads to a loss of interest in good family relations. THE INDIVIDUAL AND PORNOGRAPHY • Pornography is addictive, and neuroscientists are beginning to map the biological substrate of this addiction. • Users tend to become desensitized to the type of pornorgraphy they use, become bored with it, and then seek more perverse forms of pornography. • • • • Men who view pornography regularly have a higher tolerance for abnormal sexuality, including rape, sexual aggression, and sexual promiscuity. Prolonged consumption of pornography by men produces stronger notions of women as commodities or as “sex objects.” Pornography engenders greater sexual permissiveness, which in turn leads to a greater risk of out-of-wedlock births and STDs. These, in turn, lead to still more weaknesses and debilities. Child-sex offenders are more likely to view pornography regularly or to be involved in its distribution. OTHER EFFECTS OF PORNOGRAPHY • Many adolescents who view pornography initially feel shame, diminished self-confidence, and sexual uncertainty, but these feelings quickly shift to unadulterated enjoyment with regular viewing. • The presence of sexually oriented businesses significantly harms the surrounding community, leading to increases in crime and decreases in property values. • The main defenses against pornography are close family life, a good marriage and good relations between parents and children, coupled with deliberate parental monitoring of Internet use. Traditionally, government has kept a tight lid on sexual traffic and businesses, but in matters of pornography that has waned almost completely, except where child pornography is concerned. Given the massive, deleterious individual, marital, family, and social effects of pornography, it is time for citizens, communities, and government to reconsider their laissez-faire approach.
https://hhsu.learning.hhs.gov/communities/downloads/0112BLB22739.pdf
Since the brain believes what the eyes see, in 3/10ths of a second, real, virtual or pseudo pornography restructures the brains-minds and memories of participants or even casual viewers. That the brain’s “internal drug store” produces mood altering psychotropic drugs, and that right hemisphere emotions including fear, joy, anger, lust (instant rewards) dominate the left hemisphere’s cognitive functions of speech, rationality, logic (delayed rewards), further implicates pictorial pornography as causally changing the nature of the polity. The massive quantifiable increases and qualifiably more sadistic and barbaric kinds of sexual crime since 1950, supports the breeding of a sadistic, pedophile consciousness in pornography consumers. A picture is worth more than a thousand words and even weighty words (unless repetitively broadcast in popularly credible forums) rarely cause long-lasting cellular change. The “law of strength” finds pictorial pornography reflexively and mechanically restructuring the brain; involuntary cellular change takes place even during sleep, resisting informed consent, with left-brain dominance abrogating genuine free speech. Further, that children and non-readers accurately decode and “copy” visual images in any language establishes the non speech or anti speech nature of visual media.
http://www.drjudithreisman.com/archives/brain.pdf

Read full topic

item.title: Female president?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

yakman:

The actors? Well didn’t they choose to do this and they’re also being paid for it.

Hehe, indeed. My impression from reading Touch Wood (admittedly a biased point of view given that its the anecdotes of a porn director) was that most of the girls get incredibly pissed off when people “feel sorry for them” too - as if they’re too stupid to know what they’re doing or wouldn’t do it if they “understood” or w/e. Such a patronising view.

Also, everyone should read that book, it’s hilarious. Just treat it as a comedy rather than accurate documentary and don’t read it if you get grossed out easily, heh.

The customers? Haven’t they also chosen to buy it?

My principles say something is innocent until proven guilty. How exactly is porn guilty?

I don’t see why you’re so concerned about what consenting adults do in private. Why don’t you mind your own business?
